metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1702 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The SkRegion::readFromMemory function in core/SkRegion.cpp in Skia, as usedin Google Chrome before 51.0.2704.79, does not validate the interval count,which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-boundsread) via crafted serialized data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1702` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-browser-l10n - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-chromedriver - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242').
oxide-qt package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.15.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
